member.name: T:stringprep.steps.BidiException
member.summary: There was a problem with the Bidirection nature of a string to be prepped.

member.name: T:stringprep.steps.BidiStep
member.summary: A stringprep profile step to check for Bidirectional correctness. If the NO_BIDI flag is set, this is a no-op.

member.name: T:stringprep.steps.ProfileStep
member.summary: Base class for steps in a stringprep profile.

member.name: M:stringprep.steps.ProfileStep.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Create a named profile step, with no flags.

member.name: M:stringprep.steps.ProfileStep.Prepare(System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: This is the workhorse function, to be implemented in each subclass.
member.param: Result will be modified in place

member.name: M:stringprep.steps.BidiStep.Prepare(System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary:
Perform BiDi checks.
From RFC 3454, Section 6: In any profile that specifies bidirectional character handling, all three of the following requirements MUST be met:
The characters in section 5.8 MUST be prohibited.
If a string contains any RandALCat character, the string MUST NOT contain any LCat character.
If a string contains any RandALCat character, a RandALCat character MUST be the first character of the string, and a RandALCat character MUST be the last character of the string.

member.name: M:stringprep.steps.ProhibitStep.Contains(System.Char)
member.returns: True if the character is prohibited

member.name: M:stringprep.steps.NFKCStep.Prepare(System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: Perform NFKC. General overview: Decompose, Reorder, Compose

member.name: M:stringprep.steps.NFKCStep.CanonicalOrdering(System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: Reorder characters in the given range into their correct cannonical ordering with respect to combining class.

member.name: F:stringprep.RFC3454.A_1
member.summary: A.1 Unassigned code points in Unicode 3.2

member.name: F:stringprep.RFC3454.B_2
member.summary: B.2 Mapping for case-folding used with NFKC

member.name: F:stringprep.RFC3454.B_3
member.summary: B.3 Mapping for case-folding used with no normalization

member.name: F:stringprep.RFC3454.C_8
member.summary: C.8 Change display properties or are deprecated

member.name: F:stringprep.RFC3454.D_1
member.summary: D.1 Characters with bidirectional property "R" or "AL"

member.name: M:stringprep.unicode.Combining.Class(System.Char)
member.summary: What is the combining class for the given character?

member.name: F:stringprep.unicode.CombiningData.Classes
member.summary: Combining classes for different pages. All pages unspecified here will return combining class 0.

member.name: F:stringprep.unicode.CombiningData.Pages
member.summary: Offset into the Classes array for each page, since Classes is sparse. 255 here means that all of the combining classes for that page are 0.

member.name: T:stringprep.unicode.Compose
member.summary: Combine combining characters, where possible. Note: this is still Black Magic, as far as I can tell.

member.name: M:stringprep.unicode.Compose.Combine(System.Char,System.Char,System.Char@)
member.summary: Combine two characters together, if possible.
member.param: The combined character, if method returns true. Otherwise, undefined.

member.name: T:stringprep.unicode.ComposeData
member.summary: Data for composition of characters. The algorithms here are still black box to me.

member.name: F:stringprep.unicode.ComposeData.FIRST_START
member.summary: Where the first range of offsets from Data starts. These are used for checking the first character in a pair with a second character in Array.

member.name: F:stringprep.unicode.ComposeData.FIRST_SINGLE_START
member.summary: Where the offsets of the range of characters where there is only one match for the second character, with a given first character.

member.name: F:stringprep.unicode.ComposeData.SECOND_START
member.summary: Where the offsets of the range of second characters that match a given first character starts.

member.name: F:stringprep.unicode.ComposeData.SECOND_SINGLE_START
member.summary: When there is only a single match to the left for these characters on the right, the offsets for that chunk of characters starts here.

member.name: F:stringprep.unicode.ComposeData.Data
member.summary: The offset into Array for each character. This array is compressed using the Table table, which provides page offsets for the pages that are non-zero.

member.name: F:stringprep.unicode.ComposeData.Table
member.summary: Page offsets into Data for each page of characters.

member.name: F:stringprep.unicode.ComposeData.FirstSingle
member.summary: When the offset for the first character is in the range [FIRST_SINGLE_START, SECOND_START), look up the corresponding character here with the offset from Data to see if it is the second character. If not, there is no combination.

member.name: F:stringprep.unicode.ComposeData.SecondSingle
member.summary: When the offset for the second character is in the range [SECOND_SINGLE_START...), look up the corresponding character here with the offset from Data to see if it is the first character. If not, there is no combination.

member.name: F:stringprep.unicode.ComposeData.Array
member.summary: Array of composition pairs, indexed by offset (from Data) of first character, and offset of second character.

member.name: M:stringprep.unicode.Decompose.Find(System.Char)
member.summary: Look up the expansion, if any, for the given character.
member.returns: the expansion, or null if none found.

member.name: F:stringprep.unicode.DecomposeData.Offsets
member.summary: Offset into the Expansion string for each decomposable character. One way to make this faster might be to have this not be sparse, so that the lookup could be direct rather than a binary search. That would add several hundred K to the library size, though, or time at startup to initialize an array from this.

member.name: F:stringprep.unicode.DecomposeData.Expansion
member.summary: How to expand characters. Since multiple input characters output the same string, this table is compressed to only have one copy of each, and the Offsets table gives offsets into this for each input.

member.name: T:stringprep.Nameprep
member.summary: RFC 3491, "nameprep" profile, for internationalized domain names.

member.name: M:stringprep.Profile.#ctor(stringprep.steps.ProfileStep[])
member.summary: Create a new profile, with the given steps.

member.name: M:stringprep.Profile.Prepare(System.String)
member.summary: Prepare a string, according to the specified profile.

member.name: M:stringprep.Profile.Prepare(System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: Prepare a string, according to the specified profile, in place. Not thread safe; make sure the input is locked, if appropriate. (this is the canonical version, that should be overriden by subclasses if necessary)
member.param: The string to prepare in place

member.name: T:stringprep.Plain
member.summary: A relatively plain stringprep profile, that doesn't do case folding, or prevent unassigned characters.

member.name: T:stringprep.XmppNode
member.summary: A stringprep profile for draft-ietf-xmpp-nodeprep-02, for Jabber nodes (the "user" part).

member.name: M:stringprep.XmppNode.#ctor
member.summary: Create a new XmppNode profile instance.

member.name: T:stringprep.XmppResource
member.summary: A stringprep profile for draft-ietf-xmpp-resourceprep-02, used for Jabber resources.

member.name: M:stringprep.XmppResource.#ctor
member.summary: Create an instance of an XmppResource
